content.description: Mixed route.  Follow three black bolts to chains.  There are a variety of cracks down lower that take good cam placements, up to #1 C4.  There is a mini-crux right before the last bolt that can seem a little tenuous.  A bomber nut up and left will protect the move (something like a BD 7). Clip the last bolt and mantle to the chains (crux).
content.location: The slab to the left of One Eyed, shares chains.  Currently the second route you pass as you hike into the crag.

content.description: A good slab left of great wide open.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a couple pieces, small wire before first bolt and a number 1 Camelot between 2nd and 3rd  bolts. 2 BB at top.
content.location: Left of great wide open, the clean grey slab between water streaks. Rap route with single 60m rope.

content.description: First route climbed at slabs, nice outing up a flake that dog legs up the slab. Climb flake to anchor. Nice moves lay backing and a mantle to top.
content.protection: A single bolt belay at base to stop your belayer falling down slope! A couple of small wires and or cams plus a bolt and fixed pin.
content.location: On the first slab you see on approach. The flake is obvious. Start on a large flake leaning against the slab, there is a belay bolt at bottom, rap from anchors

content.description: The other obvious arête left of blue steel. Great rock with a feisty crux at the obvious dogleg in arête about a third of the way up. Thin moves past this to a good finger crack and a cam. Continue up past a couple more bolts to top.
content.protection: Bolts and gear, medium to small.
content.location: Sharp arête  left of blue steel. Rap off anchor single rope

content.description: This climbs the face left of snake eyes.first climb some easy cracks with gear to where the slab gets compact and steepens. Bolt then balancy moves straight up to a good #2camalot and foot stance below crux and another bolt. Thin smears follow to a shallow flake and a good piece  of gear in a slot. Follow the crack up and right past more gear to the snake eyes anchor
content.protection: Trad up to 2 camalot and two bolts. Uses snake eyes anchors
content.location: Face left of snake eyes. Single rope rap from snake eyes anchors.

content.description: This route has now been straightened out with a direct start. Start at the bottom of the large corner system to the right of snakes and ladders. Climb slab to left but use corner for pro up to 4". Move left to a bulge, small cam in a horizontal protects some slabby moves to a ledge and bolt, continue up to original bolt then follow flakes and main corner with good cams to 2".  Clip a pin and make crux moves over smooth stone, then more cams protect the last moves to a semi hanging belay. 2BB. Rap off chains single 60m rope.
content.protection: Cams up to 4", 2 bolts and one pin.
content.location: To the right of snakes and ladders,it is the obvious left facing corner. Rap the route.

content.description:
This climb is on a different section further left as you look at the crag. Hike up the scree slope to the center of the compact grey slab. P1 starts in a sea below a bolt, straight up past three bolts and gear to number 1 Camelot. 2 BB. 5.8.30m

P2 heads up and left through two roof lines to gain a dished slab with a shallow corner in the middle. Five bolts, a pin and small cams up to a .75. Very nice pitch pulling through roofs, great moves. Ends at a 2 BB at an awesome ledge. 5.8+30m

P3 climbs directly above belay following seams and a couple easy bulges to a 2 BB , gear to 2 Camelot. 5.7 30 m.
content.protection:
Cams and wires to 2 inch

Bots interspersed throughout.

2BB belays every anchor.
content.location: Single 60 m rope gets you down.

content.description: This little slab is immediately left of snakes and ladders and is a fun toprope after you have rapped off the previous climb.

climbs.name: Boys don't cry
climbs.fa: P1 Tim ball rope solo. P2 Tim ball frank Gould

content.description:
The first pitch climbs the obvious arete to the right of great wide open. Clip a bolt and make some slabby moves up to a diagonal crack with good nut pro. Continue up the arete past three more bolts and some gear to a 2BB on a good ledge. 30m, 5.8.

P2 Continue up the arete past a bolt , over a bulge with good pro and into the shallow corner system on the right, fixed pin, some gear then another bolt. Make harder moves stemming and smearing up the corner, good gear to 3" then a 2BB at another good ledge. 30m, 5.9+. Great pitch.

The route will probably continue past this pitch but hasn't been done yet.
content.location: This is the arete 30' to the right of great wide open. The first bolt is about 10' off the deck. Single 60 m rap off fixed anchors.

climbs.name: Blue steel arete
climbs.fa: Tim ball, jodie hamilton, bob Bergdahl Janie Bergdahl

content.description: This climbs the obvious sharp arête to the left of two bit whore. Fun balancy moves up the arête to anchor. Watch for a little loose block about half way up. Tried to get it out many times!
content.protection: Mixed gear and bolts. Gear up to #2 camalot
content.location: This is the right hand of two obvious orange arête so that can be seen from the road. Single rope rappel.

climbs.name: Big girl panties
climbs.fa: Tim ball, Molly Myers, Brynn Clemons

content.description: This route starts by climbing two bit whore to the intermediate anchor. It is better to belay here for drag. Climb up and left above anchor, good cam, then onto arête and a bolt. Pull around left and follow slab/ arête past a large block forming an under cling, bolt. Move up and left to top of flake and steep bulge, bolt. Launch out left on obvious white flake till you can pull around to good stance and bolt. Did you have your big girl panties on? Go straight up to anchor, rap route.
content.protection: Bolts , long slings helpful. Anchor on top.
content.location: Rap to ground on single 70 or use intermediate anchor.

content.description: This is the route previously known as chicks and ticks. I finally got around to putting a couple bolts in it and is a fun lead.
content.location: Left of snakes and ladders, up the slab to snakes and ladders DBB.

content.description: Climb about twenty feet up on easy, clean rock to the first bolt. A cam is available before clipping this. Step right and up past some kinda thin slab by moves past two more bolts and green camalot in a slot above third bolt. Move up to an anchor and either belay here or clip it long and move right to the continuation up a clean orange arête. Two more bolts to a two bolt anchor. One long rap with a 70 or if not sure use intermediate anchor to get down.
content.protection: Mostly bolts with a little supplementary gear in the small to medium range.
content.location: This climb is up the scree and left of the snakes and ladders slab. Look for a water washed slab starting in an alcove next to an obvious right trending gully.

content.description: This climbs  the face to the left of blue steel. Move up flakes and cracks to a pin below a bulge, thin moves through this onto some sustained edging above and a little spaced gear. Continuous climbing up and right and to the right facing flake below and left of blue steel anchors.
content.protection: Gear to #3camalot and small wires. Use blue steel anchors.
content.location: Left of blue steel arête in center of slab. Rap off blue steel anchors.
